title: Platform Engineering Certified Practitioner
description: Hands-on certification for DevOps, SREs, and engineering managers that covers key platform engineering principles and practical frameworks like Platform as a Product, adoption strategies, best practices on selling platform initiatives internally.

title: Platform Engineering Certified Leader (April)
description: Advanced certification for senior tech leaders to connect platform strategy to business value through ROI, governance, and adoption frameworks that scale platform success across the organization

title: Platform Engineering Certified Professional (March)
description: Instructor-led certification for senior engineers to design and scale platforms. Covers MVP delivery, golden paths, ROI validation, and strategies to prepare secure, production-ready platforms for enterprise adoption

title: Platform Engineering Certified Architect (April)
description: Instructor-led, hands-on certification for architects, platform engineers, and DevSecOps leaders that teaches how to design and implement secure, scalable IDP foundations. You will learn security by design using OPA, Gatekeeper, and Falco, automate operations with Kubernetes Operators, and build APIs, CLIs, and UIs that deliver frictionless developer self-service and built-in compliance

title: AI in Platform Engineering
description: Platform engineering now enables enterprise AI. This course teaches you to apply AI-native capabilities to supercharge the SDLC, streamlining everything from builds to complex operations and compliance. You will then learn to design specific "platforms for AI" infrastructure, preparing you for the next evolution of the platform engineering role.

title: Introduction to Platform Engineering
description: Discover how platform engineering fixes DevOps bottlenecks. This introductory course explains key concepts, why IDPs matter, and how they help teams ship faster with less cognitive load. Your ideal first step before certification

title: Intro to AI in Platform Engineering
description: AI is changing how software teams build and run systems, but without strong platform engineering foundations organizations cannot scale it safely or effectively. This course gives you a clear, practical understanding of how AI improves platform capabilities, why platform engineering is becoming the backbone of AI initiatives, and the key practices you need to work confidently in this fast moving space.

title: Introduction to GitOps for Platform Engineering
description: This course offers a hands-on introduction to the fundamentals, principles, and architectures of GitOps for modern platform engineering. Explore how GitOps enables reliable, scalable, and self-service delivery workflows. Including a bonus interview with Alexis Richardson; co-founder and CEO of ConfigHub

title: Cloud Development Environments for Platform Engineers
description: Introductory course for platform engineers on Cloud Development Environments. Understand how CDEs enhance security, developer experience, and automation as part of a scalable platform engineering strategy

title: Kubernetes Cluster Lifecycle Management in Platform Engineering
description: Learn how to manage Kubernetes clusters across their full lifecycle. This course covers declarative management, Day 2 operations, and governance practices to reduce toil and scale platform reliability across teams

title: Observability for Platform Engineering
description: Learn how to make observability a core platform capability. This course covers OpenTelemetry, automation, and open standards to help you design reliable signals teams can trust across distributed systems

title: Vulnerability Management for Platform Engineers
description: Learn how to manage vulnerabilities across modern platforms. This introductory course covers secure-by-design principles, automated detection and remediation, and how to embed security into IDP workflows to keep teams fast and safe.

title: Performing CRUD Operations with Python
description: Create a Flask application to service all the REST APIs for adding, retrieving, updating, and deleting products. You will learn how to use CRUD operations in Python, and then you’ll create the REST API endpoints, run and test the server with cURL, and use POSTMAN to test the REST API endpoints.

title: Applied data science with Python
description: Learn Python, the most popular programming language for data science and software development. Gain proficiency in using Python libraries like Pandas and Numpy and in developing code using Jupyter notebooks.

title: Building generative AI applications with Python
description: Build generative AI-powered applications and chatbots using generative AI models, Python, and related frameworks

title: Analyze Satellite Data to Investigate Plant Health
description: Use satellite data to analyze plant health and gain insights for sustainable agriculture and plant-health monitoring. Learn techniques for using geospatial APIs and a popular and accurate index to plan for precision agriculture, resource optimization, and sustainable food production.

title: Applied data science with R specialization
description: Build your data science skills with R and SQL. Master the ability to transform data into information and insights.

title: Build Guardrails for Your AI with Open Source
description: Protect your company and brand reputation, enhance user safety and trust with advanced measures, ensuring ethical and responsible interactions. Learn to build guardrails quickly and inexpensively using open source technologies.

title: Getting Started with Machine Learning with PyTorch
description: Use PyTorch to build, train, and evaluate neural networks. Save the trained model parameters and use them later for inferencing.

title: Generative AI: Prompt Engineering Basics
description: Understand the concepts and relevance of prompt engineering in generative AI models. Practice common prompt engineering techniques and approaches and best practices for writing effective prompts.

title: Reward modeling for generative AI with Hugging Face
description: Train large language models (LLM) for reward modeling, a cutting-edge area in AI that enhances the capability of models to generate high-quality, contextually appropriate responses.

title: Build MultiAgent Chatbot with AutoGen (AG2)
description: Learn to build AI agents using AG2 (AutoGen) multi-agent framework. In this project you will create AutoMed Multi LLM Agent for health treatment recommendations.

title: Create Your Own ChatGPT-like Website with Open Source LLMs
description: Learn how to use an open-source LLM on your machine, how to host your LLM to create a chatbot website using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Python, and how to deploy your chatbot website to the web

title: Data analysis with Python
description: Get hands-on experience and learn important techniques for preparing your data for analysis. Then, learn how to gain a better understanding of your data through exploratory data analysis.

title: Mastering Translations with Generative AI in PyTorch
description: Gain the skills to preprocess data, train the model, and generate translations

title: Machine learning with Python
description: Learn about supervised vs unsupervised Learning, look into how statistical modeling relates to machine learning, and do a comparison of each.

title: Predict Sea-Rise Risks with Geospatial APIs
description: Learn to predict the risks of a rise in sea level using geospatial APIs. Featuring IBM Environmental Intelligence APIs, this project helps you predict sea levels, visualize data, and assess risks.

title: Foundations of quantum error correction
description: This course is on quantum error correction, with a focus on foundational concepts. It begins with an explanation of what quantum error correcting codes are and how they work. It then moves on to the discretization of errors phenomenon, the stabilizer formalism for describing quantum error correcting codes, Calderbank–Shor–Steane (CSS) codes, and several key examples of quantum error correcting codes, including the toric code and surface codes. The course also discusses fault-tolerant quantum computation, in which quantum computations are performed on error-corrected quantum information.

title: General formulation of quantum information
description: This course describes the general formulation of quantum information, where quantum states are represented by density matrices, changes in states are described by channels, and a more general class of measurements can be considered than those discussed in Basics of quantum information. The course also discusses mathematical ways of formalizing the distance or similarity between quantum states, and how they relate to channels and measurements in operational ways.

title: Practical introduction to quantum-safe cryptography
description: Review the basics of cryptography, and understand the challenges posed by new quantum algorithms, as well as how to mitigate the impact of that challenge through use of new quantum-safe encryption algorithms.

title: Fundamentals of quantum algorithms
description: Explore computational advantages of quantum information, including what we can do with quantum computers and their advantages over classical computers.

title: Basics of quantum information
description: Start with a mathematical description of quantum information for both single and multiple systems, then move on to quantum circuits, and finally learn about three fundamentally important examples — quantum teleportation, superdense coding, and the CHSH game — all of which are connected to the phenomenon of entanglement.

title: Data Science Methodology
description: Learn how to ensure the data you use in problem solving is relevant and properly manipulated

title: Data visualization with Python
description: Learn how to take data that at first glance has little meaning and present that data in a form that makes sense to people.

title: Data visualization with R
description: Learn the Grammar of Graphics, and how the ggplot2 data visualization package for R applies this concept to basic bar charts, histograms, pie charts, scatter plots, line plots, and box plots. Additionally, learn how to further customize your charts and plots using themes and other techniques.

title: Next Generation Platform for IBM Sterling Order Management on Cloud
description: Next Generation Platform for IBM Sterling Order Management on Cloud

title: Introduction to Large Language Models
description: In this module, you’ll explore the capabilities of large language models and their business applications. You’ll learn about the different types of IBM Granite models and the unique features that make them ideal for enterprise use. You’ll also discover how to craft effective prompts to guide these models and overcome common challenges in their use.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Spanish

title: Build Your First Chatbot Using IBM watsonx™
description: In this course, you will learn the steps to create conversational chatbots that can understand and respond to natural language. You will also understand the fundamentals of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and learn how to apply them to real-world scenarios. Through a hands-on simulation using IBM watsonx, you’ll gain the skills needed to create a simple chatbot.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Spanish

title: Prompt Engineering: Shaping Better AI Responses
description: Prompt engineering is the key to getting AI to work smarter for you; by asking the right questions, you unlock more creative, accurate, and powerful responses. In this module, you’ll identify the applications of different types of prompts used in generative AI. You’ll explore different prompt engineering techniques and find out how to select a technique best suited to your specific task. Finally, you’ll explore some best practices for writing effective prompts.

title: Turn Ideas Into Prototypes With Vibe Coding
description: In this module, you’ll discover the benefits of using vibe coding for app development, explore how vibe coding transforms ideas into functional prototypes, and learn about the best practices in vibe coding.

title: Ethical Considerations for Using Generative AI
description: In this module, you’ll explore the fascinating and complex world of ethics as they relate to generative AI. You’ll learn about the pillars of transparency, accountability, and fairness. You’ll discover ethical considerations and risks related to data inputs to AI systems and uncover the ethical implications of AI-generated output. Finally, you’ll be introduced to the IBM AI risk atlas.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, French, Indonesian, Japanese, Spanish

title: Unleashing the Power of AI Agents
description: In this module, you’ll explore AI agents, how they perform tasks, and the different types of AI agents that exist. You’ll learn how to identify key use cases where AI agents improve efficiency and categorize them based on how they make decisions. Finally, you’ll learn how AI agents work and where they are making an impact today.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Japanese, Spanish, Turkish

title: The Rise of Multiagent Systems
description: In this module, you learn about multiagent systems and how they differ from single-agent systems. You explore how agents interact and work together and discover the ways these systems solve complex problems across different industries. Through practical examples, you uncover the power of agents collaborating to create innovative solutions.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Japanese, Spanish,Turkish

title: Vector Embeddings: AI’s Key to Meaning
description: In this module, you learn about how when searching online, the words used in a query often don’t exactly match the words in the content being sought. That’s where vector embeddings come in. They help AI to capture meaning by recognizing patterns and relationships across different types of data, rather than focusing only on exact words.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Spanish

title: Classifying Data Using IBM Granite
description: In this module, you’ll explore the role of generative artificial intelligence in simplifying tasks involving classifying data. You’ll identify methods for selecting an IBM Granite model for classifying text-based data and examine various prompts to use within these models.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Spanish

title: Introduction to Retrieval-Augmented Generation
description: In this module, you’ll learn what RAG is and identify its key use cases. Next, you’ll explore the benefits of using RAG to enhance the knowledge base of an AI model. Finally, you’ll find out the key steps in the RAG workflow.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Italian, Japanese, Spanish, Turkish

title: Explore Text to Speech Using IBM watson®
description: This module introduces the fundamentals of text-to-speech (TTS) technology and the role of generative AI in developing these systems. Through a hands-on simulation using IBM watsonx, you’ll gain the skills needed to create and refine your own AI-powered voice synthesis model.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Spanish

title: IBM Granite Models for Software Development
description: In this module, you’ll discover how generative artificial intelligence is rewriting the rules of code creation. You’ll learn about IBM Granite models and discover their different types and the benefits they bring to your coding journey. You’ll also learn how to use IBM Granite models to troubleshoot code, allowing you to identify and fix issues faster. You’ll discover the value of Granite models for software developers and be able to explain how to use them.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Japanese, Spanish

title: Summarizing Data Using IBM Granite
description: In this module, you’ll explore the role of generative AI in text-based data summarization. Next, you’ll learn about various IBM Granite models for text summarization and how you can choose the right model for your needs. Finally, you’ll explore how to prompt IBM Granite models to summarize text.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Spanish

title: Use Generative AI for Software Development Using IBM watsonx™
description: In this course, you’ll learn how AI can help you write new code, switch code between programming languages, and fix common coding issues. You’ll get a chance to practice using IBM watsonx in a simulation to generate code with the help of simple prompts.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Japanese, Spanish

title: AI in Healthcare: Improving Care and Efficiency
description: In this module, you’ll discover the benefits of using AI in healthcare and review some use cases. You’ll also explore the key challenges of using AI in healthcare and find out how to address them effectively.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Japanese, Spanish

title: AI in Legal: From Research to Results
description: In this module, you’ll discover the benefits of using AI in the legal industry and some key use cases. You’ll also explore the potential concerns related to using AI for legal tasks and the ways to address the concerns.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Spanish

title: The Power of Personalized Finance with AI
description: Artificial intelligence is enabling financial institutions to tailor guidance, products, and support to individuals by analyzing behavior, anticipating needs, and adapting in real time. In this module, you’ll explore examples of personalized financial experiences, learn how different AI technologies make them possible, and discover which applications fit various financial settings.

title: Transforming the Sports Fan Experience with AI
description: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing the sports fan experience by turning passive spectators into active participants. In this module, you’ll explore how AI is changing the way fans connect with sports. You’ll explore how evolving fan preferences are driving these changes and get a glimpse of future opportunities where AI could make the fan experience even more exciting and inclusive.

title: AI’s New Superpower: Multimodal Retrieval-Augmented Generation
description: In this module, you’ll learn what multimodal RAG is and explore how it differs from text-only RAG. Next, you’ll discover the steps in a multimodal RAG system workflow and find out about some challenges associated with it. Finally, you’ll learn about some real-life applications of multimodal RAG.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Spanish, Indonesian

title: Elevate Education with AI
description: In this module, you’ll explore how educators use AI in classrooms. You’ll learn the four main forms of AI and how each one supports different educational needs. You’ll discover generative AI tools, including prompt patterns that can help you receive better output. You also examine challenges surrounding AI in education and how teachers, administrators, and schools can use AI responsibly.

title: Risk Management and Fraud Detection using Generative AI
description: Explore how generative AI is changing risk management and fraud detection. You’ll examine how you can train and use generative AI to supplement risk management and fraud detection work. You’ll investigate how you can apply generative AI capabilities to realistic risk management and fraud detection scenarios. Finally, you’ll learn about key concerns that can arise when you use generative AI in risk management and fraud detection.

title: Getting Started with Artificial Intelligence
description: This credential earner demonstrates a foundational understanding of Artificial Intelligence concepts and processes, including common applications of AI, and generative AI. The individual has worked with generative AI tools to refine and create prompts.

title: Getting Started with Generative AI
description: This course introduces foundational concepts of generative AI, including how machines create text and images, the ethical considerations involved, and the use of tools like the IBM AI Risk Atlas. Learners will explore practical applications of large language models such as IBM Granite in areas like customer service and content creation.

title: Generative AI Essentials: Using LLMs to Work with Data
description: Unlock the power of generative AI to simplify data analysis and transform your ability to extract insights from unstructured data. With this program, you’ll harness the unique elements of the data analysis tool, including its ability to handle multilingual data and perform sentiment analysis.

title: AI Literacy
description: Explore real-world use cases across industries and practice guiding an AI assistant to solve a hands-on business challenge. Whether you’re a student, job seeker, educator, or lifelong learner wanting to know more about AI, this course is for you, giving you the foundation to recognize, evaluate, and use AI responsibly.

title: Make Agentic AI Work for You
description: Gain the skills to harness the power of AI agents, accelerate your understanding of RAG, and transform your approach to complex challenges with multiagent systems. With hands-on experience through simulation use cases, such as enhancing HR virtual assistants with RAG and automating procurement, you’ll be propelled to continue learning in this rapidly evolving field, driving meaningful impact and shaping the future of AI.

title: Artificial Intelligence Fundamentals
description: This credential earner demonstrates knowledge of artificial intelligence (AI) concepts, such as natural language processing, computer vision, machine learning, deep learning, chatbots, and neural networks; AI ethics; and the applications of AI. The individual has a conceptual understanding of how to run an AI model using IBM Watson Studio. The earner is aware of the job outlook in fields that use AI and is familiar with the skills required for success in various roles in the domain.

title: Build Smarter AI with Embeddings
description: In this module, you’ll explore the concept of vector embeddings and their role in AI. You’ll learn how to generate and optimize text embeddings using appropriate models and discover how image embeddings are created and fine-tuned for optimal performance.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Spanish

title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Enhanced AI Outputs
description: In this module, you’ll discover use cases for using RAG, explore the workflow a RAG system uses for content generation, and learn best practices to improve RAG system outputs. You’ll also explore naive, advanced, and modular RAG implementation techniques and discover best practices to overcome challenges associated with a RAG system.

title: Craft Precise Prompts for AI Models
description: In this module, you’ll explore how to write prompts to generate required output from generative AI models such as large language models (LLMs). You’ll also learn how to create prompt templates with variables to generate output from LLMs.

title: Building AI Solutions Using Advanced Algorithms and Open Source Frameworks
description:
This badge earner demonstrates knowledge and understanding in technical and scientific concepts related to building AI solutions with open-source frameworks (such as TensorFlow and Keras) to make model predictions using regression, classification, and clustering algorithms such as Naive Bayes, Logistic regression, K-nearest neighbors, Polynomial Linear Regression, SVM (Kernel), Decision tree, and Ensemble learning, K means and DBSCAN for anomaly detection and computer vision.
* The design of the credential emblem has been refreshed as part of an update to the SkillsBuild Credential Framework. Learn more here

title: Building Trustworthy AI Enterprise Solutions
description:
This badge earner has completed all the learning activities included in this online learning experience, including hands-on experience, concepts, methods, and tools related to exploring the ethical adoption of AI technologies in the enterprise. The individual has demonstrated skills and understanding of the use of AI technologies for business, including: AI industry adoption trends, AI ethical considerations, Natural Language Processing, and Virtual Agents.
* The design of the credential emblem has been refreshed as part of an update to the SkillsBuild Credential Framework. Learn more here

title: Code Generation and Optimization Using IBM Granite
description: In this module, you’ll explore how to use IBM Granite models to address a variety of programming challenges. You’ll learn how to generate efficient, reliable, and adaptable code tailored to your project’s needs and optimize the code to improve its performance.

title: Data Classification and  Summarization Using IBM Granite
description: In this module, you’ll explore how to construct, judge, and improve prompts for classifying and summarizing data. You’ll practice prompting an IBM Granite model to classify and summarize data, and discover how to adjust model parameters for enhanced output quality, model outputs, and use evaluation insights to adjust prompts and parameters. Finally, you’ll practice adjusting the model parameters to refine the output.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Spanish

title: Intelligent by Design: Build an AI Agent
description: Are you interested in exploring how to build an AI agent? In this module, you discover how AI agents work, explore different agent types, and learn how to structure effective workflows. You’ll also evaluate performance, apply ethical design principles, and prepare your agent for deployment in real-world scenarios.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Spanish

title: AI-Enabled Applications for Customer Service
description: This course explores the role of artificial intelligence in transforming customer service operations. It covers the fundamentals of AI technologies, their application in customer service, and their impact on businesses and customer experiences. You will learn how to design and implement AI-driven customer service systems, including chatbots, sentiment analysis, personalization, and more to improve customer experience.

title: Generative AI in Action
description: This credential earner has applied technical knowledge of principles of generative AI, prompt engineering techniques, and Python libraries. The individual has demonstrated general knowledge of the methods, applications, and ethical considerations of using GenAI models. The earner has practiced essential workplace skills and explored generative AI career pathways.

title: Artificial Intelligence Practitioner Pathway
description: The Artificial Intelligence Practitioner Pathway prepares you for careers in AI through the learning of AI concepts such as machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, data analytics, AI ethics, and more. You will explore use cases and applications of AI and experience AI through simulations and labs. Whether you are a beginner exploring the field or an experienced professional seeking to expand your knowledge, this course will provide you with a solid foundation in artificial intelligence and its role in the workplace and society.

title: Create a chatbot with IBM watsonx Assistant
description: In this lab, you will learn how to build a chatbot and add various actions and steps to create an interactive and intelligent assistant for your website.

title: Energy Demand Forecasting with IBM Granite Time Series
description: Forecasting in time series analysis allows data scientists to identify patterns by using machine learning and then generate forecasts about the future. TinyTimeMixers (TTMs) are compact pre-trained models for Multivariate Time-Series Forecasting.  The goal of this lab is to show how you can predict future trends on historical data using the IBM Granite Time Series models.

title: Entity Extraction from Description Related to a Book Using IBM Granite
description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable accuracy in the task of entity extraction. In this lab, you will learn how to extract key entities from descriptions related to books using IBM Granite-8B.

title: Explore machine learning and data science in IBM watsonx
description: Learn how to use the machine learning and data science capabilities of IBM watsonx to process and analyze data, build a binary classification model, and build a multivariate time series forecasting model.

title: Document Summarization with IBM Granite
description: This lab showcases the essential capabilities of IBM Granite models through bite-sized instructional notebooks. In this lab, you will apply summarization techniques using IBM Granite.

title: Prompt a Foundation Model in IBM watsonx
description: In this lab, you’ll be introduced to the generative AI features in IBM watsonx.ai, the Prompt Lab, foundation models, prompt engineering, and workspaces, and then get hands-on experience with prompting a foundation model.

title: Retrieval Augmented Generation with LangChain
description: This notebook contains instructions for performing Retrieval Augumented Generation (RAG). RAG is an architectural pattern that can be used to augment the performance of language models by recalling factual information from a knowledge base, and adding that information to the model query.

title: Build an AI-Powered Document Retrieval System with IBM Granite and Docling
description: In this lab, you will learn how to take a set of source documents, convert them into text and then split the text into chunks, derive embedding vectors using the embedding model, and load it into the vector database. Creating this vector database will allow you to easily search across the documents, enabling you to use Retrieval-augmented generation.

title: Build an AI-Powered Multimodal RAG System with IBM Granite and Docling
description: Multimodal RAG can use multimodal LLMs (MLLM) to process information from multiple types of data to be included as part of the external knowledge base used in RAG. In this lab, you’ll learn to harness the power of advanced tools to build an AI-powered multimodal RAG pipeline.

title: Craft Responsible Prompts
description: Responsible Prompting is an LLM-agnostic tool that aims at dynamically supporting users in crafting prompts that reflect responsible intentions and help avoid undesired or negative outputs. This lab covers crafting prompts using the IBM Granite Embedding Models in the Responsible Prompting API.

title: Implement RAG Using LlamaIndex Orchestration Framework
description: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) is a cutting-edge approach that combines the strengths of information retrieval and generative AI models. By integrating external knowledge sources, RAG enables AI systems to generate more accurate and contextually relevant responses. This lab covers implementing a simple Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) architecture using the LlamaIndex orchestration layer and a knowledge base stored in ChromaDB.

title: Implement a ReAct Design Pattern with IBM Granite
description: In this lab, you will learn about the ReAct design pattern and its essentials, you will implement ReAct from the ground up and be introduced to techniques to level up ReAct for more complex use cases and production ready settings.

title: Use Inference Scaling to Improve Multimodal RAG
description: Inference scaling in AI enhances model performance by optimizing the use of computational resources during this inference phase. In this lab, you’ll learn to harness the power of inference scaling to improve the multimodal RAG pipeline created in a previous lab.

title: Getting Started with Cybersecurity
description: This credential earner demonstrates a foundational understanding of cybersecurity key elements and the threats it addresses, including concepts of data privacy, and how to evaluate data security using the CIA triad model. The earner is aware of the job outlook in cybersecurity and is familiar with the skills required for success in various roles. The individual understands how a cybersecurity tool works.

title: Cybersecurity Fundamentals
description: This badge earner demonstrates a foundational understanding of cybersecurity concepts, objectives, and practices. This includes cyber threat groups, types of attacks, social engineering, case studies, overall cyber security risk management strategies, cryptography, and common approaches that organizations take to prevent, detect, and respond to cyber attacks. This also includes an awareness of the job market. Badge earners can use this knowledge to pursue further education for a variety of roles in cybersecurity.
languages: English, Arabic, Bahasa, Brazilian Portuguese, French, German, Japanese, Spanish

title: Level Up Cybersecurity with Generative AI
description: In this module, you’ll explore features of generative AI used in cybersecurity. You’ll discover how gen AI helps with cybersecurity incidents by enabling faster threat detection, better decision making, and automating time-consuming tasks. You’ll also learn how gen AI handles specific cybersecurity problems in the healthcare, finance, and public sectors.
languages: English, Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Indonesian, Spanish

title: Enterprise Security in Practice
description:
This badge earner has completed all the learning activities included in this online learning experience, including hands-on experience, concepts, methods and tools related to the enterprise security domain. The individual has demonstrated skills and understanding in the approaches to elevate an organization’s overall security posture, by adopting practices, methods and tools that increase enterprise cyber resilience.

title: Getting Started with Threat Intelligence and Hunting
description:
This badge earner has completed all the learning activities included in this online learning experience, including hands-on experience, concepts, methods and tools related to the threat intelligence and hunting domain. The individual has demonstrated domain knowledge and understanding in adopting practices, methods and tools that relates to the activities performed in cyber threat hunting.

title: Security Operations Center in Practice
description:
This badge earner has completed all the learning activities included in this online learning experience, including hands-on experience, concepts, methods and tools related to the Security Operations Center’s domain. The individual has developed skills around techniques, technologies, roles and scenarios needed to establish the foundations of a Security Operations Center (SOC) within an organization.
* The design of the credential emblem has been refreshed as part of an update to the SkillsBuild Credential Framework. Learn more here

title: Cybersecurity Fluency Pathway
description: As technology advances, ensuring the security of digital assets and protecting the online presence of individuals and organizations have emerged as critical priorities. Every industry now finds itself in need of skilled cybersecurity professionals. Whether you are a beginner exploring the field or an experienced professional seeking to expand your knowledge, this course will provide you with a solid foundation in cybersecurity. You will delve into key concepts, terminology, and essential principles, and engage in activities with tools, frameworks, and scenarios to help you apply and practice what you’ve learned.

title: Getting Started with Data
description: This credential earner demonstrates a foundational understanding of data concepts, such as types of data, big data, the data analytics process, data visualization, and the data science landscape. The individual has worked with data analytics tool to import, analyze and visualize data.

title: Supercharge Your Data Analytics with Generative AI
description: In this module, you’ll gain a practical understanding of how generative AI is reshaping data analytics. You’ll learn to classify core generative AI capabilities such as automation and synthetic data generation. You’ll also explore how these tools apply at different stages of the data analytics process, from data preparation to insight delivery. Finally, you’ll discover the key risks that come with these technologies and what responsible AI use looks like in real-world analytics settings.

title: Data Fundamentals
description: This credential earner demonstrates knowledge of data analytics concepts, methodologies and applications of data science, and the tools and programming languages used in the data ecosystem. The individual has a conceptual understanding of how to clean, refine, and visualize data using IBM Watson Studio. The earner is aware of the job outlook in data and is familiar with the skills required for success in various roles in the domain.

title: Enterprise Data Science in Practice
description:
This badge earner has completed all the learning activities included in this online learning experience including hands-on labs, concepts, methods, and tools related to the data science methodology. They demonstrate skills and understanding of the Data Science methodology by engaging in real-wold scenarios and role-playing the process/tools used by a data science team to address real-world enterprise challenges in the insurance industry leveraging cutting-edge fraud analytics approaches and technologies.
* The design of the credential emblem has been refreshed as part of an update to the SkillsBuild Credential Framework. Learn more here

title: Machine Learning for Data Science Projects
description:
This earner completed all learning activities included in this online learning experience related to advanced topics core to the data science profession including: Data Modeling techniques; Machine Learning; Deep Learning algorithms; Data Science Automation; demonstration of advanced skills application in the field of Data Science by role-playing critical roles in a data science team using latest AI tools for analytics/automation to address real problems.
* The design of the credential emblem has been refreshed as part of an update to the SkillsBuild Credential Framework. Learn more here

title: Data Analytics Fluency Pathway
description: In today’s data-driven world, being able to extract meaningful insights from data is an invaluable skill. Every industry is now finding itself in need of skilled data analytics professionals. Whether you are a beginner exploring the field or an experienced professional seeking to expand your knowledge, this course will provide you with a solid foundation in using data to help drive informed decision making. You will explore real-world scenarios, navigate data sets, and craft compelling visual narratives to help you apply and practice what you’re learning. You will delve into key concepts, terminology, and essential principles that will make you fluent in this crucial discipline.

title: Cloud Computing Fundamentals
description: This credential earner demonstrates knowledge of cloud computing, including cloud services, deployment models, virtualization, orchestration, and cloud security. The individual is aware of cloud benefits for users and businesses. The individual has a conceptual understanding of how to create a container, deploy a web app to the cloud, and analyze security in a simulated environment. The earner is aware of the job outlook in cloud computing and the skills required for success in various roles.

title: Journey to Cloud: Envisioning Your Solution
description:
This credential earner demonstrates knowledge and understanding of the digital transformation drivers made possible by cloud technologies and services. This includes: how cloud works, its capabilities, types, and delivery models (IaaS, SaaS, and PaaS); digital transformation strategies such as Agile practices, the IBM Garage Method, and Enterprise Design Thinking to help organizations get started on their transformation journey; and deploying a test pilot cloud application using IBM Code Engine.
* The design of the credential emblem has been refreshed as part of an update to the SkillsBuild Credential Framework. Learn more here

title: Journey to Cloud: Orchestrating Your Solution
description:
This credential earner demonstrates knowledge and understanding in the intricate relationship between the enterprises embracing the journey to Cloud adoption and the cloud service providers. The credential earner acquired advanced skills on cloud computing adoption concepts such as compliance, data management, data protection, cloud security, service management and operations, ITIL, incident, problem and change management, site reliability engineering, AIOps, and governance.
* The design of the credential emblem has been refreshed as part of an update to the SkillsBuild Credential Framework. Learn more here

title: Journey to Cloud: Transforming Your Culture
description:
This credential earner demonstrates knowledge and understanding in cloud adoption concepts such as cloud culture, modern cloud practices, and the corresponding roles, with a focus on cloud development practices such as DevOps & Agile. The credential earner explores technical concepts such as cloud-native architecture, microservices, containerization, and APIs and understands what organizational changes may be required when an organization decides to migrate its workloads to the cloud.
* The design of the credential emblem has been refreshed as part of an update to the SkillsBuild Credential Framework. Learn more here
